info.title: WebApplicationFirewallManagement
info.description: APIs to manage web application firewall rules.

post.description: Check the availability of a Front Door resource name.
Check the availability of a Front Door subdomain.

get.description: Lists all available managed rule sets.

Backend.description: Backend address of a frontDoor load balancer.

address.description: Location of the backend (IP address or FQDN)

privateLinkAlias.description: The Alias of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this backend is 'Private'

privateLinkResourceId.description: The Resource Id of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this backend is 'Private'

privateLinkLocation.description: The location of the Private Link resource. Required only if 'privateLinkResourceId' is populated

privateEndpointStatus.description: The Approval status for the connection to the Private Link

privateLinkApprovalMessage.description: A custom message to be included in the approval request to connect to the Private Link

httpPort.description: The HTTP TCP port number. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The HTTPS TCP port number. Must be between 1 and 65535.

enabledState.description: Whether to enable use of this backend. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

priority.description: Priority to use for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority backend is healthy.

weight.description: Weight of this endpoint for load balancing purposes.

backendHostHeader.description: The value to use as the host header sent to the backend. If blank or unspecified, this defaults to the incoming host.

BackendPool.description: A backend pool is a collection of backends that can be routed to.

properties.description: Properties of the Front Door Backend Pool

BackendPoolProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a Backend Pool.

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

BackendPoolUpdateParameters.description: A collection of backends that can be routed to.

backends.description: The set of backends for this pool

loadBalancingSettings.description: Load balancing settings for a backend pool

healthProbeSettings.description: L7 health probe settings for a backend pool

BackendPoolsSettings.description: Settings that apply to all backend pools.

enforceCertificateNameCheck.description: Whether to enforce certificate name check on HTTPS requests to all backend pools. No effect on non-HTTPS requests.

sendRecvTimeoutSeconds.description: Send and receive timeout on forwarding request to the backend. When timeout is reached, the request fails and returns.

CacheConfiguration.description: Caching settings for a caching-type route. To disable caching, do not provide a cacheConfiguration object.

queryParameterStripDirective.description: Treatment of URL query terms when forming the cache key.

queryParameters.description: query parameters to include or exclude (comma separated).

dynamicCompression.description: Whether to use dynamic compression for cached content

cacheDuration.description: The duration for which the content needs to be cached. Allowed format is in ISO 8601 format (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations). HTTP requires the value to be no more than a year

type.description: Type of Front Door resource used in CheckNameAvailability.

CheckNameAvailabilityOutput.description: Output of check name availability API.

nameAvailability.description: Indicates whether the name is available.

reason.description: The reason why the name is not available.

message.description: The detailed error message describing why the name is not available.

certificateSource.description: Defines the source of the SSL certificate

protocolType.description: Defines the TLS extension protocol that is used for secure delivery

minimumTlsVersion.description: The minimum TLS version required from the clients to establish an SSL handshake with Front Door.

frontDoorCertificateSourceParameters.description: Parameters required for enabling SSL with Front Door-managed certificates (if certificateSource=FrontDoor)

CustomRule.description: Defines contents of a web application rule

name.description: Describes the name of the rule.

priority.description: Describes priority of the rule. Rules with a lower value will be evaluated before rules with a higher value.

enabledState.description: Describes if the custom rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

rateLimitDurationInMinutes.description: Time window for resetting the rate limit count. Default is 1 minute.

rateLimitThreshold.description: Number of allowed requests per client within the time window.

groupBy.description: Describes the list of variables to group the rate limit requests

action.description: Defines the action to take on rule match.

DefaultErrorResponse.description: Error response indicates Front Door service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

ErrorResponse.description: Error response indicates Front Door service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

Experiment.description: Defines the properties of an Experiment

ExperimentProperties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

description.description: The description of the details or intents of the Experiment

endpointA.description: The endpoint A of an experiment

endpointB.description: The endpoint B of an experiment

resourceState.description: Defines the server side resource status

status.description: The description of Experiment status from the server side

scriptFileUri.description: The uri to the Script used in the Experiment

ExperimentUpdateModel.description: Defines modifiable attributes of an Experiment

ExperimentUpdateProperties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

description.description: The description of the intent or details of the Experiment

customForwardingPath.description: A custom path used to rewrite resource paths matched by this rule. Leave empty to use incoming path.

forwardingProtocol.description: Protocol this rule will use when forwarding traffic to backends.

cacheConfiguration.description: The caching configuration associated with this rule.

backendPool.description: A reference to the BackendPool which this rule routes to.

FrontDoor.description: Front Door represents a collection of backend endpoints to route traffic to along with rules that specify how traffic is sent there.

properties.description: Properties of the Front Door Load Balancer

FrontDoorCertificateSourceParameters.description: Parameters required for enabling SSL with Front Door-managed certificates

certificateType.description: Defines the type of the certificate used for secure connections to a frontendEndpoint

FrontDoorProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the Front Door.

cname.description: The host that each frontendEndpoint must CNAME to.

rulesEngines.title: A rules engine configuration.
rulesEngines.description: Rules Engine Configurations available to routing rules.

extendedProperties.description: Key-Value pair representing additional properties for frontdoor.

FrontDoorUpdateParameters.description: The properties needed to update a Front Door

friendlyName.description: A friendly name for the frontDoor

routingRules.description: Routing rules associated with this Front Door.

loadBalancingSettings.description: Load balancing settings associated with this Front Door instance.

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings associated with this Front Door instance.

backendPools.description: Backend pools available to routing rules.

frontendEndpoints.description: Frontend endpoints available to routing rules.

enabledState.description: Operational status of the Front Door load balancer. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

FrontendEndpoint.description: A frontend endpoint used for routing.

FrontendEndpointLink.description: Defines the Resource ID for a Frontend Endpoint.

FrontendEndpointProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a frontend endpoint.

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

customHttpsProvisioningState.description: Provisioning status of Custom Https of the frontendEndpoint.

customHttpsProvisioningSubstate.description: Provisioning substate shows the progress of custom HTTPS enabling/disabling process step by step.

customHttpsConfiguration.description: The configuration specifying how to enable HTTPS

FrontendEndpointUpdateParameters.description: Frontend endpoint used in routing rule

hostName.description: The host name of the frontendEndpoint. Must be a domain name.

sessionAffinityEnabledState.description: Whether to allow session affinity on this host. Valid options are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

sessionAffinityTtlSeconds.description: UNUSED. This field will be ignored. The TTL to use in seconds for session affinity, if applicable.

webApplicationFirewallPolicyLink.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for each host (if applicable)

FrontendEndpointUpdateParametersWebAppli.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for each host (if applicable)

GroupByVariable.description: Describes the variables available to group the rate limit requests

variableName.description: Describes the supported variable for group by

HeaderAction.description: An action that can manipulate an http header.

headerActionType.description: Which type of manipulation to apply to the header.

headerName.description: The name of the header this action will apply to.

value.description: The value to update the given header name with. This value is not used if the actionType is Delete.

HealthProbeSettingsModel.description: Load balancing settings for a backend pool

properties.description: Properties of the health probe settings

HealthProbeSettingsProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a health probe settings.

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

HealthProbeSettingsUpdateParameters.description: L7 health probe settings for a backend pool

path.description: The path to use for the health probe. Default is /

intervalInSeconds.description: The number of seconds between health probes.

healthProbeMethod.description: Configures which HTTP method to use to probe the backends defined under backendPools.

enabledState.description: Whether to enable health probes to be made against backends defined under backendPools. Health probes can only be disabled if there is a single enabled backend in single enabled backend pool.

KeyVaultCertificateSourceParameters.description: Parameters required for bring-your-own-certification via Key Vault

vault.description: The Key Vault containing the SSL certificate

secretName.description: The name of the Key Vault secret representing the full certificate PFX

secretVersion.description: The version of the Key Vault secret representing the full certificate PFX

KeyVaultCertificateSourceParametersVault.description: The Key Vault containing the SSL certificate

LatencyMetric.description: Defines the properties of a latency metric used in the latency scorecard

name.description: The name of the Latency Metric

endDateTimeUTC.description: The end time of the Latency Scorecard in UTC

aValue.description: The metric value of the A endpoint

bValue.description: The metric value of the B endpoint

delta.description: The difference in value between endpoint A and B

deltaPercent.description: The percent difference between endpoint A and B

aCLower95CI.description: The lower end of the 95% confidence interval for endpoint A

aHUpper95CI.description: The upper end of the 95% confidence interval for endpoint A

bCLower95CI.description: The lower end of the 95% confidence interval for endpoint B

bUpper95CI.description: The upper end of the 95% confidence interval for endpoint B

properties.description: The properties of a latency scorecard

LatencyScorecardProperties.description: Defines a the properties of a Latency Scorecard

id.description: The unique identifier of the Latency Scorecard

name.description: The name of the Latency Scorecard

description.description: The description of the Latency Scorecard

endpointA.description: The A endpoint in the scorecard

endpointB.description: The B endpoint in the scorecard

startDateTimeUTC.description: The start time of the Latency Scorecard in UTC

endDateTimeUTC.description: The end time of the Latency Scorecard in UTC

country.description: The country associated with the Latency Scorecard. Values are country ISO codes as specified here- https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html

latencyMetrics.description: The latency metrics of the Latency Scorecard

LoadBalancingSettingsModel.description: Load balancing settings for a backend pool

properties.description: Properties of the load balancing settings

LoadBalancingSettingsProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create load balancing settings

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

LoadBalancingSettingsUpdateParameters.description: Round-Robin load balancing settings for a backend pool

sampleSize.description: The number of samples to consider for load balancing decisions

successfulSamplesRequired.description: The number of samples within the sample period that must succeed

additionalLatencyMilliseconds.description: The additional latency in milliseconds for probes to fall into the lowest latency bucket

defaultState.description: Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state.

defaultAction.description: Defines the action to take on rule match.

defaultSensitivity.description: Defines the sensitivity for the rule.

description.description: Describes the functionality of the managed rule.

ManagedRuleExclusion.description: Exclude variables from managed rule evaluation.

matchVariable.description: The variable type to be excluded.

selectorMatchOperator.description: Comparison operator to apply to the selector when specifying which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

selector.description: Selector value for which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

ruleGroupName.description: Name of the managed rule group.

description.description: Description of the managed rule group.

rules.description: List of rules within the managed rule group.

ManagedRuleGroupOverride.description: Defines a managed rule group override setting.

ruleGroupName.description: Describes the managed rule group to override.

exclusions.description: Describes the exclusions that are applied to all rules in the group.

rules.description: List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.

ManagedRuleOverride.description: Defines a managed rule group override setting.

enabledState.description: Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state.

action.description: Defines the action to take on rule match.

sensitivity.description: Defines the sensitivity for the rule.

exclusions.description: Describes the exclusions that are applied to this specific rule.

ruleSetType.description: Defines the rule set type to use.

ruleSetVersion.title: ruleSetAction
ruleSetVersion.description: Defines the version of the rule set to use.

ruleSetAction.description: Defines the action to take when a managed rule set score threshold is met.

exclusions.description: Describes the exclusions that are applied to all rules in the set.

ruleGroupOverrides.description: Defines the rule group overrides to apply to the rule set.

ManagedRuleSetDefinition.description: Describes the a managed rule set definition.

properties.description: Properties for a managed rule set definition.

ManagedRuleSetDefinitionProperties.description: Properties for a managed rule set definition.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the managed rule set.

ruleSetId.description: Id of the managed rule set.

ruleSetType.description: Type of the managed rule set.

ruleSetVersion.description: Version of the managed rule set type.

ruleGroups.description: Rule groups of the managed rule set.

ManagedRuleSetList.description: Defines the list of managed rule sets for the policy.

selector.description: Match against a specific key from the QueryString, PostArgs, RequestHeader or Cookies variables. Default is null.

operator.description: Comparison type to use for matching with the variable value.

negateCondition.description: Describes if the result of this condition should be negated.

items.description: Describes what transforms applied before matching.

enabledState.description: Describes if the policy is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

mode.description: Describes if it is in detection mode or prevention mode at policy level.

redirectUrl.description: If action type is redirect, this field represents redirect URL for the client.

customBlockResponseStatusCode.description: If the action type is block, customer can override the response status code.

customBlockResponseBody.description: If the action type is block, customer can override the response body. The body must be specified in base64 encoding.

requestBodyCheck.description: Describes if policy managed rules will inspect the request body content.

javascriptChallengeExpirationInMinutes.description: Defines the JavaScript challenge cookie validity lifetime in minutes. This setting is only applicable to Premium_AzureFrontDoor. Value must be an integer between 5 and 1440 with the default value being 30.

captchaExpirationInMinutes.description: Defines the Captcha cookie validity lifetime in minutes. This setting is only applicable to Premium_AzureFrontDoor. Value must be an integer between 5 and 1440 with the default value being 30.

logScrubbing.description: Defines rules that scrub sensitive fields in the Web Application Firewall logs.

PolicySettingsLogScrubbing.description: Defines rules that scrub sensitive fields in the Web Application Firewall logs.

state.description: State of the log scrubbing config. Default value is Enabled.

scrubbingRules.description: List of log scrubbing rules applied to the Web Application Firewall logs.

PreconfiguredEndpoint.description: Defines the properties of a preconfigured endpoint

PreconfiguredEndpointProperties.description: Defines the properties of a preconfigured endpoint

Profile.description: Defines an Network Experiment Profile and lists of Experiments

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

etag.description: Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

ProfileProperties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

resourceState.description: Defines the server side resource status

ProfileUpdateModel.description: Defines modifiable attributes of a Profile

ProfileUpdateProperties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

contentPaths.description: The path to the content to be purged. Can describe a file path or a wild card directory.

redirectType.description: The redirect type the rule will use when redirecting traffic.

redirectProtocol.description: The protocol of the destination to where the traffic is redirected

customHost.description: Host to redirect. Leave empty to use the incoming host as the destination host.

customPath.description: The full path to redirect. Path cannot be empty and must start with /. Leave empty to use the incoming path as destination path.

customFragment.description: Fragment to add to the redirect URL. Fragment is the part of the URL that comes after #. Do not include the #.

customQueryString.description: The set of query strings to be placed in the redirect URL. Setting this value would replace any existing query string; leave empty to preserve the incoming query string. Query string must be in <key>=<value> format. The first ? and & will be added automatically so do not include them in the front, but do separate multiple query strings with &.

RouteConfiguration.description: Base class for all types of Route.

RoutingRule.description: A routing rule represents a specification for traffic to treat and where to send it, along with health probe information.

properties.description: Properties of the Front Door Routing Rule

RoutingRuleLink.description: Defines the Resource ID for a Routing Rule.

RoutingRuleProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a routing rule.

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

RoutingRuleUpdateParameters.description: Routing rules to apply to an endpoint

frontendEndpoints.description: Frontend endpoints associated with this rule

acceptedProtocols.description: Protocol schemes to match for this rule

patternsToMatch.description: The route patterns of the rule.

enabledState.description: Whether to enable use of this rule. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

routeConfiguration.description: A reference to the routing configuration.

rulesEngine.description: A reference to a specific Rules Engine Configuration to apply to this route.

webApplicationFirewallPolicyLink.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for each routing rule (if applicable)

RoutingRuleUpdateParametersWebApplicatio.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for each routing rule (if applicable)

RulesEngine.description: A rules engine configuration containing a list of rules that will run to modify the runtime behavior of the request and response.

properties.description: Properties of the Rules Engine Configuration.

RulesEngineAction.description: One or more actions that will execute, modifying the request and/or response.

requestHeaderActions.description: A list of header actions to apply from the request from AFD to the origin.

responseHeaderActions.description: A list of header actions to apply from the response from AFD to the client.

selector.description: Name of selector in RequestHeader or RequestBody to be matched

rulesEngineOperator.description: Describes operator to apply to the match condition.

negateCondition.description: Describes if this is negate condition or not

rulesEngineMatchValue.description: Match values to match against. The operator will apply to each value in here with OR semantics. If any of them match the variable with the given operator this match condition is considered a match.

items.description: Describes what transforms are applied before matching

RulesEngineProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a Rules Engine Configuration.

resourceState.title: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.
resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door or Front Door SubResource.

RulesEngineRule.description: Contains a list of match conditions, and an action on how to modify the request/response. If multiple rules match, the actions from one rule that conflict with a previous rule overwrite for a singular action, or append in the case of headers manipulation.

name.description: A name to refer to this specific rule.

priority.description: A priority assigned to this rule.

action.description: Actions to perform on the request and response if all of the match conditions are met.

matchConditions.description: A list of match conditions that must meet in order for the actions of this rule to run. Having no match conditions means the actions will always run.

matchProcessingBehavior.description: If this rule is a match should the rules engine continue running the remaining rules or stop. If not present, defaults to Continue.

RulesEngineUpdateParameters.description: Rules Engine Configuration to apply to a Routing Rule.

rules.description: A list of rules that define a particular Rules Engine Configuration.

SecurityPolicyLink.description: Defines the Resource ID for a Security Policy.

Sku.description: The pricing tier of the web application firewall policy.

TimeseriesDataPoint.description: Defines a timeseries datapoint used in a timeseries

dateTimeUTC.description: The DateTime of the Timeseries data point in UTC

value.description: The Value of the Timeseries data point

TimeseriesProperties.description: Defines the properties of a timeseries

endpoint.description: The endpoint associated with the Timeseries data point

startDateTimeUTC.description: The start DateTime of the Timeseries in UTC

endDateTimeUTC.description: The end DateTime of the Timeseries in UTC

aggregationInterval.description: The aggregation interval of the Timeseries

country.description: The country associated with the Timeseries. Values are country ISO codes as specified here- https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html

timeseriesData.description: The set of data points for the timeseries

ValidateCustomDomainInput.description: Input of the custom domain to be validated for DNS mapping.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

customDomainValidated.description: Indicates whether the custom domain is valid or not.

reason.description: The reason why the custom domain is not valid.

message.description: Error message describing why the custom domain is not valid.

properties.description: Properties of the web application firewall policy.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

etag.description: Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

sku.description: The pricing tier of web application firewall policy. Defaults to Classic_AzureFrontDoor if not specified.

WebApplicationFirewallPolicyProperties.description: Defines web application firewall policy properties.

customRules.description: Describes custom rules inside the policy.

managedRules.description: Describes managed rules inside the policy.

frontendEndpointLinks.description: Describes Frontend Endpoints associated with this Web Application Firewall policy.

routingRuleLinks.description: Describes Routing Rules associated with this Web Application Firewall policy.

securityPolicyLinks.description: Describes Security Policy associated with this Web Application Firewall policy.

WebApplicationFirewallScrubbingRules.description: Defines the contents of the log scrubbing rules.

matchVariable.description: The variable to be scrubbed from the logs.

selectorMatchOperator.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operate on the selector to specify which elements in the collection this rule applies to.

selector.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operator used to specify which elements in the collection this rule applies to.

state.description: Defines the state of a log scrubbing rule. Default value is enabled.
